titleStmt.title: TO THE RIGHT Honourable Sir Thomas West, Knight, Lord Lawarre, all peace, prosperitie, and happinesse.
titleStmt.author: Creswell, George

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: TO THE RIGHT Honourable Sir Thomas West, Knight, Lord Lawarre, all peace, prosperitie, and happinesse.
analytic.author: Creswell, George

monogr.title: The harmonie of the lawe and the gospel : Wherin is plainly shewed, that howsoeuer they differ in time and some other circumstances, yet in substance they are one & the same. And by waie of application, the pretended antiquitie of Poperie is discouered, and found to be a meere nouelty: deliuered in a sermon at Pauls-crosse, the 9. of Aug. 1607. by George Cresvvell, minister of Gods word
monogr.author: Creswell, George

div.head: TO THE RIGHT Honourable Sir Thomas West, Knight, Lord Lawarre, all peace, prosperitie, and happinesse.
div.p:
RIght Honourable, hauing at the request of a religious Knight (an Alderman of the Cittie of London) gathered this my Sermon into writing, and deliuered him the Copie; I was soone after desired (nay, importuned) by
others (my worshipful good friends) to giue consent for the printing of it. Which, when I could not, in good manners (as I thought) farther put off; I was at length induced to condescend vnto: the rather, both in regard of the benefit, which by this my weake meanes may growe to the Church of God: as also, that (by seeking shelter vnder your Ho: protection) I had now a fitte opportunitie (long wisht-for) to manifest my dutifull respect, and humble affection to your Lordship. This your Patronage, if it please your Honour (as an addition to your former fauours) gratiously to vouchsafe mee; I cannot but also acknowledge my selfe herein the more obliged in
al boundē duties. Thus, humbly crauing your Lordships fauourable acceptance of my faithful endeauours, I take my leaue.

closer.signed: Your Honours, euer in all duty: GEO. CRESWELL.
